Job Title: Platform Manager - Data & AI - Transformation - Hawthorn East
Ad Text:
We’ve been trusted to serve Aussie communities since 1914 and grown to become a top 30-listed on the ASX with over 115,000 team members and a portfolio of iconic brands. At Coles Group, you’ll not only get to make a difference to millions of Aussie lives—you’ll also get to see your impact.

About the team

As the way Australians shop continues to evolve, our Data and AI Team keep Coles at the forefront of modern retail. We combine data, artificial intelligence, and applied engineering to reimagine how our stores, supply chain, and digital channels operate — creating smarter, more connected, and seamless experiences for our customers and team members.

Operating as a centralised development and enablement function within Coles Technology, the team unites product, engineering, and platform capabilities to deliver the intelligence layer of the enterprise. We serve every part of Coles — from computer vision applications that enhance in-store experiences and reduce loss, to forecasting, optimisation, and decision-support solutions that drive efficiency, accuracy, and agility across our supply chain, retail operations, and corporate functions.

The scale and impact of this work are significant. Coles serves millions of customers each week across more than a thousand stores nationwide, and our AI and data capabilities provide the intelligence that underpins how we plan, move, sell, and serve. By combining deep data capability with applied AI and modern engineering, we’re enabling Coles to become a truly AI-enabled enterprise, transforming how we operate and how Australia shops every day.

About the role

For this exciting position within our Data and Artificial Intelligence team, we are seeking an experienced Platform Manager – Transformation to lead end-to-end planning, execution, and delivery of platform transformation programs ensuring alignment to enterprise Data & AI strategy and business outcomes.

Working closely with the Senior Platform Manager – Transformation, your main responsibilities will include the following but not be limited to the below: 

Drive the adoption of modern cloud infrastructure, containerisation, microservices, Infrastructure as Code and automation frameworks.
Collaborate closely with architecture, security, data governance, and compliance teams to embed standards and controls into the evolving platform.
Manage risks, dependencies, and resources proactively to maintain project momentum and delivery quality.
Facilitate knowledge sharing and cross-team collaboration to accelerate transformation and build organisational capability.
Deliver timely reporting and transparent communication on project status, risks, and opportunities to senior leadership.
Identify opportunities to optimise costs, improve performance, and enhance scalability within the platform environment.
Foster a culture of experimentation, innovation, and accountability within the transformation team.

We are looking for a versatile leader to lead, mentor, and grow a team of platform engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and high performance.

You will inspire and motivate cross-functional teams to embrace change and deliver transformational outcomes aligned with enterprise goals whilst acting as a change agent, promoting Agile methodologies, DevOps practices, and continuous delivery culture throughout transformation initiatives.

Experience required

Proven years of experience in platform management, IT transformation, or technical program management in data and AI environments.
Proven track record delivering complex platform transformation or cloud migration projects.
Working experience with cloud platforms (Azure, Snowflake, Databricks), containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes), and automation tools (Terraform, Ansible).
Familiarity with modern data platform technologies, AI/ML infrastructure, and scalable architecture patterns.
Experience in agile methodologies and cross-functional team leadership.
Understanding of data governance, security, and compliance requirements in large enterprises.

Commercial Skills and Formal Qualifications

Strong project and program management skills with ability to drive delivery in complex environments.
Technical expertise in cloud infrastructure, platform automation, and modernisation frameworks.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
Leadership skills with experience managing technical teams.
Relevant certifications in cloud platforms, project management, or transformation methodologies are advantageous.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

What’s in it for you?
Flexible working options: We know that work is only one part of your life, so we actively encourage a positive work-life balance and provide hybrid working options to help you achieve it.
Office perks: Take advantage of our gym facility and fitness classes, free parking, BBQ area, mini-Coles supermarket, fooderie hub where you can sample new products before they hit the shelves, school holiday program and so much more when you come in.
Discounts: Eligible team members receive 5% discount all year round on your Supermarket and Liquor online and in-store purchases. We also offer additional periods of double discount (10%) at various times throughout the year. As well as hotdeals exclusive to team members that translate into additional savings.
Reward through recognition: Give and receive recognition, linked to our Coles values, through our digital recognition platform ‘mythanks’. You can accumulate points to redeem in the online shop for exciting gifts and electronic gift cards from an extensive range of retailers.
Opportunities for learning and development: No matter where you start within our diverse business, you’ll have experiences, exposure, and education to satisfy you. Discover and explore a variety of career development programs and job-specific training.
Paid parental leave: We understand how important your life outside work is and offer permanent team members paid parental leave to support you in balancing work and family.
Investment in your future: Our annual team member share plan offer allows eligible team members to make regular pre-tax salary sacrifice deductions to purchase Coles Group shares.

About the recruitment process

We’re continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that is just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We are committed to creating a workplace that is safe and respectful for our team. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities.

We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. For further information and additional contact details visit the ‘Our Recruitment Process’ section of our careers site or email inclusionrecruitment@coles.com.au

Job ID: 166720

Employment Type: Full time

Job Title: Python Strategy & Research Tooling Engineer – Trading Systems Innovation
Ad Text:
Join a world-class trading firm at the forefront of technology and innovation, headquartered in Sydney — the heartbeat of APAC’s electronic markets. It’s where advanced systems are engineered, ideas accelerate, and performance never slows down. Drive innovation by optimizing ultra-low-latency trading systems, uncovering performance edges, and collaborating across elite global engineering teams.

What You’ll Do:

Engineer high-performance Python-based systems supporting strategy development, research, and trading.

Build scalable tools for data analysis, model training, backtesting, and visualization.

Collaborate with researchers, quants, and traders to transform prototypes into live trading strategies.

Enhance distributed computation frameworks for large-scale quantitative research.

Your Responsibilities Will Include:

Developing automation solutions to support risk management and mid-office processes.

Creating and optimizing research tooling to accelerate model development.

Working across multiple teams to gather feedback and continuously improve internal systems.

Maintaining and expanding Python-based infrastructure for real-time trading and analysis.

Why Join Us:

Be part of a highly technical, collaborative environment where innovation directly impacts performance.

Gain exposure to front-office trading technology and cutting-edge quantitative research.

Work with engineers and researchers who thrive in a flat structure with full ownership of their work.

Enjoy a supportive culture that values skill growth, creativity, and continuous learning.

About You:

Strong Python engineering experience, ideally with distributed or data-intensive systems.

Background in quantitative, trading, or fintech environments a plus.

Comfortable working full stack and “doing what needs to be done.”

Passionate about building tools that empower others and drive measurable impact.

Join us to engineer the backbone of next-generation trading research — where every line of code shapes smarter, faster strategies.

#Python #QuantResearch #TradingTechnology #DistributedSystems #MachineLearning #Automation #FinTech #ResearchEngineering #BackTesting #DataVisualization #FrontOffice #RiskManagement #SoftwareEngineering #QuantTools #Innovation

Job Title: LCS Business Strategy and Operations Senior Associate, GTM
Ad Text:
At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.

Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in management consulting, sales operations, business strategy, investment banking, venture capital, private equity, or corporate advisory, or 2 years of experience with an advanced degree.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience using Business Intelligence (BI) and dashboards, and analyzing large data sets.
Ability to work and succeed in a fluid and an ambiguous environment.
Excellent collaboration skills, and ability to work with people from a range of backgrounds and experience.
Excellent communication, teamwork, and presentation skills.
Strong focus on execution and getting things done, balancing quality with speed.
About the job


The Go-to-Market (GTM) team is the trusted sounding board for the Australia New Zealand leadership team. We are a team who can solve complex problems and bring strategies to life while ensuring that the business runs flawlessly. We help shape the future through go-to-market strategy, power the business through seamless operational excellence and grow leaders. Team members are strategic and analytical, with the ability to execute quickly and get things done.

As a Strategy and Operations Senior Associate, you will provide business critical insights and recommendations that support decision making, cross-functional alignment of goals and expectations, and drive/help teams to execute plans and operate.

In this role, you will respond to problem statements raised by the local leadership team via hypothesis generation, analyzing information, assessing potential options, and putting forward recommendations.

You will help to set the focus, pace, and direction of our business across AUNZ Large Customer Sales and unite teams to deliver on Google’s most important business opportunities by supporting, challenging, and enabling our sales organization.

Responsibilities

Draw interpretable insights from sophisticated business analyses and advanced modeling.
Design processes, tools, and operating cadences to achieve organizational outcomes.
Develop comprehensive sales, product or business strategies that solve complex business challenges and address the needs of customers and stakeholders across various functions to drive incremental growth.
Communicate data-driven recommendations to leadership and to the broader organization in structured presentations, identifying key takeaways.
Define actionable plans and roadmaps and align cross-functional stakeholders to drive successful implementation of change initiatives.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Salary: Our people build skills for the future
Ad Text:
Job Description

The KPMG Actuarial and Advanced Analytics team is a trusted advisor delivering innovative actuarial and high-end data science services and products to both government and private sector clients.

One of the core growth areas for the team is the rapidly expanding field of climate and nature risk. We work with organisations to quantify their climate risks and opportunities (both physical and transition), using actuarial-based techniques to risk modelling. To date we have worked with organisations across a range of industries including government, finance, agriculture, construction, energy and utilities both in Australia and internationally. In each case, we aim to deliver tangible and actionable risk insights which drive the climate and transition strategies of our clients and support local and overseas reporting requirements.

With rapidly escalating demand for climate risk quantification, we are looking for a talented person at Manager level with a strong actuarial (or similar analytical) background and a passion for climate risk. They will play a crucial role in continuing to expand our climate risk quantification offering, managing and delivering climate risk projects, supporting development of new and innovative solutions and reaching a broader client base.

Your opportunity

Work closely with partners, directors and other experienced staff in multidisciplinary teams to solve client problems

Have client facing opportunities and be involved in whole projects not just tasks, giving you the opportunity to gain a broad understanding of wider business issues

Contribute to capability development and internal knowledge sharing through identification of emerging themes, problems and opportunities

Use insight to present compelling stories that deliver tangible value to clients

Apply actuarial and data analytics skills to help our clients better understand their climate risk exposures, model impacts, evaluate the impact of strategic initiatives and plan for a resilient business future

Refine your technical skills by building complex geospatial probabilistic models

Develop and implement new client offerings, leveraging the latest technology and KPMG’s alliance partnerships

We will offer career development through an extensive support and mentoring network and will require a drive to innovate.

How are you extraordinary?

You love being part of a collaborative and multidisciplinary team and building strong relationships both internally and externally.

You are tuned in to business development opportunities, with confidence creating effective sales material including proposals, case studies, and other sector-specific material. 

You are able to digest, distil, and communicate complex concepts in both written and verbal forms.

You are passionate about the climate and the energy transition and are excited to help make a difference for organisations as they adapt to the changing climate.

Your Experience

This role can be tailored to fit the talented individual with the right aspirations.

For this role, you will ideally have:

Experience in managing projects and teams, and proactively taking initiative

Experience working in actuarial and/or data analysis

Interest and experience in applying actuarial and data analytics skills outside of traditional actuarial areas of work, especially related to climate risk

Commercial acumen to proactively identify and understand business needs and be able to suggest impactful solutions

Ability to translate complex actuarial or analytical insights and/or outcomes into presentations (written and verbal) to senior stakeholders (both internal and external)

Practical experience in Excel, Python, R, and SQL

A passion for using technology, data and analytics to maximise the value actuaries can bring to organisations, and an ability to manage multiple tasks at the same time.

A desire to be a consultant with passion to make a difference to your clients, be progressive in your thinking and willing to invest in your own career and develop in a supportive team environment.

Additional Information

We offer rewarding careers in Australia for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship.

We also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues; and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.

We believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of KPMG and its ongoing success. So if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results, talk to us first.

KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth. 

Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who’ve got your back. You’ll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture.

At KPMG, you’ll take control over how you work. We’re embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more.

Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Attraction Support Team.

At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.

This role is perfect for someone who thrives on exploring the latest advancements in technology, including artificial intelligence, and enjoys turning complex business challenges into opportunities for growth. As the driving force behind innovation initiatives, you will play a pivotal part in shaping the future of the organisation by fostering a culture of experimentation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.



What you'll do:

As an Innovation Manager based in Melbourne, you will be at the forefront of driving transformative change within a highly respected financial services organisation. Your day-to-day activities will involve working collaboratively with diverse teams across the business to identify areas where emerging technologies can make a real difference. You will take ownership of projects from initial concept through to full-scale implementation, ensuring each initiative aligns with strategic objectives while upholding rigorous ethical standards.



Lead the identification and assessment of emerging technologies and artificial intelligence capabilities that are relevant to current business challenges and future opportunities.
Collaborate closely with various business units to define innovation use cases and develop proof-of-concepts or prototypes that demonstrate tangible value.
Manage multiple innovation projects throughout their entire lifecycle, from ideation and experimentation through to deployment and scaling within operational environments.
Build and nurture strong relationships with internal stakeholders, external partners, and technology vendors to ensure successful project outcomes.
Facilitate engaging innovation workshops, design sprints, and capability-building sessions that inspire creativity and foster a culture of learning.

What you bring:

To excel as an Innovation Manager in this role, you will bring a wealth of experience gained from previous positions focused on driving technological change within large organisations. Your expertise in artificial intelligence-spanning both conceptual understanding and practical application-will enable you to identify high-impact opportunities for improvement. You will possess outstanding interpersonal skills that allow you to engage effectively with stakeholders at all levels while facilitating productive workshops that encourage creative problem-solving. Your familiarity with regulatory frameworks ensures that every initiative meets stringent compliance requirements without compromising on ethical standards.



Proven experience working in roles focused on innovation, emerging technology adoption, or digital transformation within complex organisations.
A strong understanding of artificial intelligence concepts along with hands-on experience in use case development and deployment practices.
Demonstrated ability to translate intricate business problems into effective technology-enabled solutions that deliver clear benefits.
Exceptional stakeholder engagement skills combined with excellent facilitation abilities and clear communication across all levels of an organisation.

What sets this company apart:

This organisation stands out as a leader in the financial services sector due to its unwavering commitment to fostering an inclusive culture where collaboration and shared success are prioritised above all else. Employees benefit from flexible working arrangements that support work-life balance while also enjoying access to extensive training programmes designed to promote professional growth at every stage of their career journey.

What's next:

If you are passionate about harnessing emerging technologies to drive positive change within financial services-and want to be part of an inclusive team dedicated to continuous improvement-this could be your next career move!



Apply today by clicking on the link provided; take the first step towards shaping the future of innovation in Melbourne.

Robert Walters Australia is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

A bit about us 
At Judo, we're more than just a business bank – we're pioneers in redefining business banking for the modern era. Rooted in timeless values such as integrity, trusted relationships, and a challenger spirit, we're dedicated to revolutionising business banking for Small to Medium Enterprises (SMEs) across Australia. Our journey began in 2016 with a bold vision and a PowerPoint slide, driven by a desire to challenge the status quo in an industry dominated by the major players. In just a few short years, we've grown exponentially, establishing ourselves as one of the fastest-growing new banks globally, with 30 offices spanning the nation. 

At the heart of our ethos lies a commitment to supporting Australian SMEs, placing our people and customers front and centre in everything we do. Our agility and adaptability enable us to say 'yes' when other banks say 'no', making it easier for our customers to secure the funding they need, precisely when they need it. We take immense pride in our personal approach to banking, fostering diverse relationships and cultivating a collaborative culture within our team. 


Our culture – come and join a multi-award-winning place to work 
We firmly believe that culture eats strategy for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and the most important investment we can make is in our people. Our Values of trust, teamwork, accountability and performance underpin the foundation of our culture.
 
We're not your average bank. Judo was built from the ground up, with one purpose: to be the most trusted SME business bank in Australia. We made sure to cultivate a space where bureaucracy is left at the door - where our customers come first with relationships at the core of what we do. We aspire to think differently, inviting new ideas, and creating a space where everyone feels like they belong because we know that it's our unique differences that make us collectively stronger. 


We are thrilled to be externally recognised for our unique culture too! We were awarded the #1 ranking in LinkedIn’s Top Companies in Australia list as well as named in the AFR’s BOSS Best Places To Work list for 2 years in a row. We’re also super proud to be included in the 2024 HRD Australia 5-Star Employers of Choice list. 

Our people and our culture are truly our secret sauce.
 




Now, about this role…
As a Senior Analyst, Credit Assurance, you’ll play a key role in delivering Judo’s annual credit assurance plan. You’ll ensure that policy, processes, and regulations are correctly applied during loan originations, and provide valuable insights to the business to strengthen our credit risk management framework.

If you love:

Analysing credit portfolios and identifying areas for improvement
Conducting deep-dive and thematic reviews to ensure risk settings and policies are robust
Collaborating with business partners to drive change and share insights
Working in a fast-paced, agile environment where your attention to detail makes a real difference
Being part of a team that values trusted relationships and a hands-on approach

Then this just might be… Your dream job:

Delivering on Judo’s Credit Assurance annual plan through portfolio reviews and assurance activities
Providing insights and recommendations to ensure policies and frameworks are operating effectively
Coaching and guiding the first line relationships team to uplift credit quality and risk awareness
Building and maintaining strong relationships with business partners and stakeholders
Supporting continuous improvement in credit risk management and assurance processes
 



A little bit about you…
You thrive in a collaborative, high-performing team and have a passion for credit risk and assurance. You’re inquisitive, resilient, and bring a common-sense approach to complex problems.

Minimum 5 years’ experience in financial services, ideally in business banking, credit, assurance, or related fields
Strong understanding of business credit activities, SME business models, and associated risks
Experience in end-to-end assurance reviews, including testing, sampling, and process review
Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills
Agile mindset with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
Sound knowledge of regulatory and business banking lending environments
Ability to assess risk appetite, policies, and procedures, and ensure adherence
Strong relationship-building and stakeholder management skills

Your life pre-Judo:

Experience in credit risk, assurance, or business banking roles within financial services
Exposure to SME lending and portfolio management
Demonstrated ability to deliver assurance or audit activities in a regulated environment 

At Judo, our culture sets us apart:
Our Values:

Accountability: Make decisions and own them. Do what you say.
Performance: Strive to improve each day, surpassing yesterday's achievements.
Teamwork: We're not just a team; we're a champion team.
Trust: The cornerstone of our purpose and relationships.

We're seeking individuals who embody resilience, positivity, curiosity, hunger for success, adaptability, passion, courage, decisiveness, and a hands-on approach.

What our team members say about us:
Our people are empowered to make decisions, take ownership, and contribute to a collaborative environment. Bureaucracy is non-existent as we focus on collective success. At Judo, diversity isn't just valued; it's celebrated. We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone thrives, making us collectively stronger. Our team works tirelessly towards our purpose while enjoying the journey of revolutionizing Australian SME business banking.

Perks of joining us: 

Additional 2 weeks of leave annually (that’s 6-weeks per year!)
Big life event leave 
Home office setup allowance 
Access to CU Health
Flexible work options, embracing a true hybrid model. 

If this resonates with you, reach out - we'd love to hear from you.  

To learn more about how Judo manages your personal information during the recruitment process, please refer to our Privacy Statement. By providing your information, you consent to its collection, use, disclosure, and management as outlined therein.  
Please no agencies! We maintain a preferred panel, and kindly request no unsolicited contact. We do not hold any responsibility for dispute over candidate ownership if you have not been engaged directly.

The Company

We are partnering with a NDIS services provider who have recently acquired another organization and are in the process of integrating this business into their current systems.

The Role

As a Systems Integration Business Analyst, you'll play a critical role in supporting the integration of Finance, Risk and LMS systems. You'll unpack current systems and processes, document requirements, and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure smooth handovers with minimal disruption.

Responsibilities:

Analyse and document current processes and system workflows
Develop process maps to support integrations
Work closely with the Solution Architect to understand system integration points
Ensure data quality is maintained across transitions
Support systems integration across teams

Requirements:

Proven experience as a Business Analyst in systems integration or ERP transitions
Strong analytical and documentation skills
Ability to work with multiple stakeholders across systems and processes
Experience with MYOB, TechOne, AlayaCare, ELMO, or Litmos is highly desirable.

Apply Today

Submit your CV directly via email to Leah Townsend on Leah.Townsend@roberthalf.com.au or by pressing the Apply button.

By clicking 'apply', you give your express consent that Robert Half may use your personal information to process your job application and to contact you from time to time for future employment opportunities. For further information on how Robert Half processes your personal information and how to access and correct your information, please read the Robert Half privacy notice: https://www.roberthalf.com/au/en/privacy. Please do not submit any sensitive personal data to us in your resume (such as government ID numbers, ethnicity, gender, religion, marital status or trade union membership) as we do not collect your sensitive personal data at this time.

Category:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Salary: The annual salary is $151,236 to $168,143 + Super
Ad Text:
NSW Independent Commission Against Corruption ("the NSW ICAC")

Join a leading, independent integrity agency

The NSW ICAC is a destination employer, with our people enjoying meaningful and rewarding work in investigating and preventing corruption across the NSW public sector, and building integrity in our public institutions. Our culture of high ethical standards is complemented by an inclusive workforce and flexible working arrangements.

Business Analyst – Project NEXUS

Let’s talk about the opportunity

The purpose of this role is primarily working with NEXUS project team, this position will provide support in upholding and improving the technical quality of technology solutions deployed across ICAC and in doing so, improve the Commission’s technology capabilities. In particular, the Business Analyst will:

Identify, analyse and document business processes, technical functions and user stories (requirements) to enhance business systems using best practice methodology and industry recognised processes, practices and systems, assisting others to decide on best approach.
Investigates problems, analyse options and provides recommendations for new and existing services, new initiatives, strategies and products to improve compliance, effectiveness and address risks.
Monitor and report on initiatives, strategies and compliance products to improve the effectiveness of processes.
Identify, analyse, manage and monitors relationships with and between stakeholders, engaging with users and stakeholders to collate needs and defines research which fits needs.
Contribute to the development, facilitation, coordination and communication of initiatives and strategies to ensure organisational consistency and adoption of best practice.
Analyse current processes, analyse and respond to customer feedback and insights and identify and implement opportunities to optimise these and contribute to ongoing improvements to products and service delivery to allow the organisation to perform more effectively.
Managing and analyzing organization change, ensuring transitions are smooth and impactful, and minimizing disruption.

This position focuses on the current and future business needs of the Commission and the technology solutions required to deliver those needs and associated change impact. This is done by reviewing, assessing, and analysing current and proposed business operations, proposing strategies and process improvements, and devising data models and technology solutions to meet business requirements.

The position must be strategically focused and have experience in developing future technology roadmaps that align to business requirements for improved efficiency and data integration.

This is a temporary 12-month, full-time position. Current NSW Government employees interested in a secondment opportunity are encouraged to apply. 

The annual salary is $151,236 to $168,143, plus employer’s contribution to superannuation (currently 12%) and annual leave loading (currently 17.5%)

Click here to view the position description.

Essential requirements

Candidates will be assessed against the following requirements:

Subject Matter Expert in the field of business analysis and process engineering.
Solid understanding of data governance, data security, and data privacy regulations.
Advanced skills in business and data analytics tools and application architectures.
Competency in Software Development Lifecycle of IT applications development to deliver end-to-end implementation of applications systems and service management process and procedures.
Possess good business acumen skills to effectively plan, estimate, negotiate, review, assess, propose, and recommend solutions to the business needs of the Commission.  
Strong communication and collaboration abilities to work effectively with cross-functional teams, build relationships with internal stakeholders at all levels, external vendors and suppliers, and IT professionals of various expertise.
Relevant tertiary qualifications would be well regarded.

Who we are

The NSW ICAC is an independent organisation that aims to protect the public interest, prevent breaches of public trust and guide the conduct of public officials in the NSW public sector. We are committed to:

investigating and exposing corrupt conduct in the NSW public sector
preventing corruption through advice and assistance
educating the NSW community and public sector about corruption and its effects.

How to apply

If you are excited by this opportunity, we look forward to receiving applications from Australian citizens, permanent residents or valid visa holders.

To start your journey to your new career at the NSW ICAC, select “apply” and provide:

A cover letter
Your resume

For support in completing your application, refer to our ICAC Application Guide.

For role specific questions, you can contact Patrick Ho, Program Manager - Project Nexus, pho@icac.nsw.gov.au.

A talent pool may be created for future permanent or temporary positions.

What we can offer you

35-hour week, with a minimum of 5 hours per day (remove for Senior Executive positions)
Flex time so that additional hours may accumulate towards days off (remove for Senior Executive positions)
Flexible working that may accommodate personal circumstances
Flexibility in start and finish times
Salary packaging options
Fitness Passport – discounted access to fitness facilities for employees and their families
Work from home two days/week subject to operational requirements
Inclusive culture
Convenient Sydney CBD location.

A career-changing position could be awaiting you, so apply now. Applications close Sunday, 23 November 2025 at 11.55 pm AEDT.

Shape the future of diverse assets with strategic impact and technical leadership.


Are you ready to take the lead in transforming how government assets are managed? i am recruiting a Senior Asset Management Analyst to play a pivotal role in shaping long-term strategies, systems, and solutions that drive value across our entire asset portfolio.


About the Role

Reporting to the Team Leader Asset Data and Systems, this senior-level position is central to the development and delivery of the asset management framework. You’ll bring deep expertise in lifecycle planning, data analysis, and financial modelling to ensure our assets are managed holistically—from acquisition to renewal.
This is a high-impact role where your insights will inform capital works, maintenance programs, and long-term financial planning. You’ll collaborate across departments, mentor asset officers, and champion continuous improvement in systems and practices.


Key Responsibilities
Lead asset strategy development aligned with the organisations long-term objectives
Provide expert lifecycle advice across diverse asset classes
Maintain and enhance the asset register in collaboration with asset owners
Support creation of asset management plans and forward budgeting mechanisms
Partner on financial reporting including the Long Term Financial Plan
Conduct advanced data and spatial analysis to inform internal and public reporting
Redesign workflows and embed best practices across operational teams
Drive system improvements and contribute to corporate reporting
Advise on asset governance policies and strategic planning
Apply predictive modelling tools for whole-of-life asset analysis
Mentor and support asset officers to build capability and ownership
Act in leadership capacity when required and perform related duties as directed

Essential Qualifications & Experience
Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering
Class C Driver’s Licence
Strong understanding of Council asset management programs
Proven project management and facilitation skills
Advanced analytical and investigative capabilities
Experience coaching staff and driving engagement
High-level proficiency in Word, Excel, Access, and Power BI
Expertise in GIS and asset financial modelling tools (e.g. MyPredictor)

Desirable
Postgraduate qualification in Civil Engineering
Advanced financial analysis skills for engineering budgets and costing

This is your opportunity to lead with purpose, influence strategic outcomes, and contribute to the sustainable management of public assets. If you’re ready to make a difference, we’d love to hear from you!

Leading financial services firm requires a permanent Business Analyst for their Sydney CBD office.

This is a unique opportunity to work closely with global financial institutions to design and deliver digital advice solutions.

Key Responsibilities;

Lead client meetings and workshops to understand business models, propositions, and the benefits of our digital advice platform.
Capture, document, and manage business requirements using collaboration tools.
Analyse requirements to uncover hidden needs, data validations, and exception scenarios.
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure platform solutions address all captured requirements.
Validate requirements and proposed solutions through workshops and walkthroughs.
Conduct testing and lead client demonstrations to confirm system functionality.
Maintain internal documentation and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
Provide regular progress updates to stakeholders and ensure timely delivery.
To succeed in this role, you have;

Experience in customer-facing Business Analyst who loves diving deep into client needs and turning them into smart, scalable solutions.
Thrive in fast-paced environments and enjoy being part of a collaborative, global team.
A bachelor’s degree.
Background in financial advice, wealth management, or broader financial services.
Experience with financial services technology platforms.
Familiarity with Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket).
Proven ability to meet client deadlines in collaborative team environments.
In return, a package consisting of Base, Super + Bonus and flexible office hours is on offer for the successful candidate.

Public transport, consisting of Buses, Trains & Trams are a 5-minute walk away.

Please call Patrick Egan at TalentWeb on 0407 261 441 for a Confidential Discussion or simply click the apply button below.

About QIC

As one of Australias leading institutional investment managers with more than $100 billion in assets under management, we have a presence across four continents, seven offices and assets across global markets.

At QIC, we believe in shared value - where delivering strong investment returns can go hand in hand with doing good for our clients, people and communities. If we invest well, we will all do better together.

Life at QIC

We know that our people perform at their best when they feel a sense of belonging and are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work every day.  We provide a supportive work environment where everyone can thrive and feel valued for their meaningful contribution in delivering for the prosperity of our clients, people and communities.

Joining QIC, you can contribute to our employee led networks that champion our diversity, equity and inclusion strategy, which consists of five key pillars: Gender Equality, LGBTQ+, Accessibility, Cultural & Linguistic Diversity, and First Nations People.

Other reasons to join us:
Flexibility and hybrid options encouraged – certified Family Inclusive Workplace
Recharge leave - additional 3 days leave per year
Annual Fitness/home office reimbursement
Ability to swap public holidays for those of personal, cultural or religious significance
26 weeks gender-neutral paid parental leave
Financial study assistance and study leave
Community leave for supporting the causes you love
Development opportunities to extend, expand and enhance your growth.
At QIC, we welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, the LGBTQI+ community, people with disabilities and people from all cultural backgrounds. We have an equitable, barrier-free application process so please inform us of your accessibility requirements in your application or you can reach out to our Talent Team on 07 3360 3800.

About the role

Are you an experienced Senior Management Accountant with a passion for innovation, financial modelling, and strategic insight? We’re looking for a forward-thinking finance professional to join our dynamic Financial Performance & Analytics team on a 12-month contract.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment, someone who combines strong analytical ability with commercial acumen and the drive to deliver high-quality outcomes. You will play a key role in supporting strategic decision-making and financial performance across the business. 

Key responsibilities:

Partner with Finance Business Partners to deliver high-impact financial modelling, variance analysis, and insightful reporting. 

Lead budgeting and forecasting as part of business-as-usual, while also tackling ad hoc business case and fee modelling assignments. 

Develop and implement improvements to financial operating models, driving efficiency and value across the business. 

Provide strategic financial advice to internal stakeholders, supporting decision-making and business growth. 

Participate as a senior member of the Financial Performance & Analytics team, championing a culture of continuous improvement and collaboration. 

About you

You are a qualified accountant (CA / CPA / CIMA or equivalent) with proven experience in investment management, financial services, or a related sector. You bring:

A forward-thinking, innovative mindset with a keen eye for detail and a passion for continuous improvement. 

Advanced Excel and financial modelling skills, your expertise will be put to the test! 

Ability to think on your feet and adapt to an ever-changing environment. 

Strong communication skills and a collaborative approach. 

Experience with Oracle is highly regarded.

If you’re ready to bring your expertise, energy, and innovative thinking to a high-performing team, we want to hear from you!

Our client, a pioneering financial institution requires a self-motivated, ambitious finance professional to join their Product Control team
  
In this broad and exciting role, your responsibilities will include:   

· Lead the daily and monthly P&L reporting and reconciliation for Commodities & Carbon desks.
· Partner with trading desks, finance, and risk teams to investigate and resolve trade, position, and cash exceptions.
· Drive system and process enhancements to improve reporting accuracy and operational efficiency.
· Provide strategic input into new product initiatives, including carbon markets and electricity expansion.
· Manage audit walkthroughs and support governance forums such as NFRC and PC forums
· Ensure compliance with internal control frameworks and contribute to non-financial risk reporting


To be considered, you must be able to demonstrate:
  
·  5+ years in Product Control or a closely related field, ideally at Senior Manager level
· Strong understanding of traded market risk products, including complex derivatives.
· Proven leadership experience with inclusive and outcome-driven style.
· Demonstrated success in delivering systems/process uplift and automation, VBA, SQL, Tableau Prep, PowerBI, Alteryx
or other analytical and automation tools
· Deep knowledge of risk management and internal control frameworks.
· VBA, SQL, Tableau Prep, PowerBI, Alteryx or other analytical and automation too


For further information or a confidential career discussion, please contact Emily at emily@fitzgeraldjenkins.com

At Arinco, we take a quality-driven approach to professional services and project delivery. Through strong attention to detail, exceeding expectations and developing good relationships with our customers we ensure quality and care is at the heart of what we do across a wide range of mid-size, government and enterprise customers.

Working at Arinco you’ll play an integral role within the broader team, working together to:

Focus on developing cutting-edge technologies using modern delivery principles
Contribute to our expert status as a Microsoft Specialised Partner and winner of the 2024 Microsoft Australian Partner of the Year
Be part of a fun, supportive team culture with passionate individuals doing great work in a flexible environment

Founded in March 2019 and headquartered in Melbourne, we are a leading technology consulting business specialising in digital transformation. Our origins are in AI, and we proudly deliver marketing-leading solutions to customers in partnership with Microsoft, as one of their top AI partners.

With 5 Microsoft partner solution designations and 10 specialisations, we are the fastest-growing strategic partner of Microsoft ANZ and the 2024 Microsoft Australian Partner of the Year Award winner. We are also among the few GitHub Verified Partners in the ANZ region.

We are currently looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our AI Transformation practice.

What you’ll do: 

Work closely with clients and/or project team to understand their business needs, analysing processes, and providing recommendations to improve efficiency and effectiveness through technology. 
Analyse processes and requirements to produce detailed user stories and detailed documentation 
Produce current state and future state workflows and user journeys 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including project managers, technical specialists and senior stakeholders to ensure successful delivery of technology solutions. 
Drive stakeholder engagement through owning, documenting and presenting detailed information and workshop facilitation. 
Work with various technical and business teams and senior leaders as appropriate, to drive delivery based on best practices, standards, and Agile methodologies 
Building business cases and surfacing options to bring business visions to life & provide details and insight to scope new projects 
Ensuring technology implementations satisfy both requirements and business goals/outcomes through benefits realisation 
Data Analysis, often simply through spreadsheet data, or other data-based tools – SQL, BI, etc. 
Involvement with acceptance testing, testing strategy and planning 

Our ideal person will have: 

  5+ years of experience working in agile environments on large technical projects including Cloud/Data/AI/Business transformation
Experience working in complex projects with different stakeholders 
Ability to define, document and assess current state processes, constraints, and risks to ensure the right problem is being solved 
Strong knowledge of Agile practices and tools for managing requirements and backlogs, such as Jira, Confluence, etc. 
Ability to think creatively and outside of the box 
Working knowledge and experience in using modern collaboration tools, such as Miro and Figma 
Highly proficient technical writing and diagramming capabilities 
Genuine and personable communication skills 
Exceptional stakeholder management skills 
Analytical by nature, inquisitive, curious and with a desire to learn 
Ideally strong MS tech stack knowledge aligned with our Arinco services

What we offer:  

People first culture – We are an authentic and empowered crew, where everyone has a voice and we succeed together
Crew connection – Regular squad outings, Crew musters, social interest groups and Crew events
A focus on learning and development –Internal development initiatives and a $2,000 L&D budget for certifications, licences, conferences or anything else you need to grow
Tech done your way - We provide a $2,500 annual allowance for you to spend on the hardware or home office equipment of your choice

The world’s biggest challenge needs you, here.

 Big challenges require big solutions. And the transition to a net-zero world is about as big as it gets. Working at Shell Energy - one of Australia’s leading energy retailers - puts you at the heart of that endeavour.

 Lead the change, from the frontline

 Ready to make your mark in a major energy brand?

This 6-month opportunity with Shell Energy is perfect for an experienced Business Analyst who thrives on problem-solving, process improvement and delivering meaningful change. Join a high-performing team in a business transforming the way Australians experience energy.

You’ll play a pivotal role in supporting Credit, Collections and Hardship projects—helping to identify, analyse and deliver system and process enhancements that improve customer outcomes and ensure compliance with regulatory and organisational standards.

With respect, integrity and honesty, responsibilities include:

What you’ll be doing

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate requirements into actionable solutions.

Analyse and document business processes, identifying opportunities for efficiency and automation.

Partner with Credit, Collections and Hardship teams to drive improvement initiatives and support ongoing transformation.

Ensure all process and project changes meet Shell Energy’s regulatory, compliance and governance standards.

Support testing, implementation and change management activities to ensure readiness and smooth adoption.

Prepare clear documentation including process maps, user stories and reports to track project outcomes.

 Here’s what you’ll need to thrive in this role:

Proven experience as a Business Analyst within credit, collections, or financial services environments.

Strong stakeholder management and communication skills.

Experience using Jira and supporting UAT/test case development.

Sound understanding of compliance and regulatory frameworks (e.g. ACCC Debt Collection Guidelines, hardship and vulnerability principles).

Excellent analytical skills and the ability to translate data into actionable insights.

Energy or utilities experience highly regarded.

 At Shell Energy, we’re helping customers decarbonise, save and simplify the way they power their homes and businesses. You’ll join a supportive team culture that values collaboration, innovation and continuous improvement, all while making a tangible impact in a 6-month window.

 This is your chance to deliver meaningful work, build relationships across the business, and leave your mark on one of Australia’s most recognised energy brands.

Why join our team

Every day, our people bring deep expertise, true innovation and investment to help our customers - and the world - reduce their environmental footprint. You can be part of that change.

 Here are the top reasons why our people choose us:

●      Purpose that you can see. You’ll have the best shot at energising a better future, one customer at a time.

●      Work that’s interesting, innovative and high impact. We hope you’ll love the challenge and opportunity to achieve - for our customers and for you.

●      People who bring the expertise and drive to succeed. Our team is respectful, inclusive, and supports connection and collaboration.

 We think you’ll love it here too. Some of our benefits include: 

●      Competitive remuneration packages

●      Flexible working arrangements, with modern workplaces and technologies that support new, hybrid ways of working.

●      An Employee Assistance Program for you and your family when you need it. 

Visit our careers site to find out more.

https://shellenergy.wd105.myworkdayjobs.com/shellenergy-aus

 

Read the stories of our incredible people.

https://shellenergy.com.au/about-us/our-people/

Join us. Together, we can make the difference count.

Shell Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values the diversity of its people. We do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, religion, colour, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability.

About Us 

At Sportsbet, we’re all about bringing excitement to life for our 2.4 million customers. As part of the global Flutter Group, we’re a tight-knit team of 1,300 in Melbourne, Sydney, and Darwin, passionate about challenging the status quo. We’re proud to be recognized as one of LinkedIn’s Top 25 Companies and one of the Top 10 Workplaces for Women. 

We’re an inclusive employer who celebrates diversity and is committed to helping you thrive. Whether you’re looking for flexibility, career growth, or a supportive environment, we’re here to help you succeed. 

Committed To Responsible Gambling 

Our commitment to responsible gambling is genuine and demonstrated through the wide range of responsible gambling initiatives and tools. We’re proud to be the leaders in responsible gambling in our industry, not just locally, but globally. 

The Opportunity

At Sportsbet, we’re reimagining what’s possible with data, machine learning and AI. We’re a fast-moving, customer-obsessed business — and we’re looking for an Operational Excellence Manager to help us scale our data science ML capabilities, processes, practices, and governance to ensure that data science models continuously deliver measurable Customer and Business value. This is a fixed term contract role.

You’ll play a pivotal role in uplifting our end-to-end machine learning ecosystem — from model design and governance to deployment and continuous improvement. Working alongside data scientists, ML engineers and business stakeholders, you’ll help industrialise how we build, deliver, and manage models that power millions of customer experiences.

This isn’t a “keep the lights on” role — it’s about shaping the frameworks, automations and governance that let AI and ML thrive safely and efficiently at scale.

What You’ll Do

Design and implement frameworks for ML governance, lifecycle management, and operational best practice.
Work closely with Heads of Data Science teams to ensure implementation of ML best practices.
Partner with Risk, Compliance and Privacy to embed ethical AI principles and standards.
Identify inefficiencies in ML workflows and introduce automation, documentation, and streamlined processes.
Champion change management and continuous improvement across data science teams — helping others adopt and scale best practice.
Stay ahead of emerging MLOps and AI Ops trends to keep Sportsbet at the cutting edge.

What You’ll Bring

3+ years’ experience in project management, business analysis, or process improvement within data or analytics teams.
Strong understanding of ML concepts, lifecycle management, and governance.
Experience driving change and embedding frameworks across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent communication and facilitation skills.
The ability to influence key stakeholders to adopt best practices
A mindset for continuous improvement and a drive to make things simpler, faster, and better.

Why You’ll Love Working Here

Along with a competitive salary and generous performance-based bonus, here’s some of our other benefits:

25 days annual leave (plus flexible working options)
Access to outstanding career development programs, including expert-led internal training and external learning opportunities
Onsite concierge services, free meals, social events and access to the Sportsbet Salon
Generous parental leave and return-to-work benefits
Hack Days: Participate in our hack days, where creativity and collaboration lead to exciting new ideas and projects.


What’s the Green Tick Feeling?

Well, it’s different for everyone, yet unites us all. It’s the feeling you get when you succeed, no matter what success looks like to you. It could be developing your career, it could be working on an industry leading project, or it could be making it to school pick up in time. It's all the little and big things that make you feel like you’re thriving when working at Sportsbet. 

We’re an inclusive employer who welcomes you for who you are, as you are – so, if you require adjustments to the recruitment process, please let us know in your application. We also know flex means different things to different people, so let us know how we can support you to be your best. 

We review applications quickly, so apply soon! Check out our Life@Sportsbet Instagram, LinkedIn, and careers website for more about our inclusive culture.

Ready for your Green Tick Feeling? Apply now.
